caption.title: Experimental spectral bandwidth.
caption.p: SRS spectral bandwidths for CH 2 (2,845 cm -1, blue lines) and CH 3 (2,940 cm -1, red lines) stretching signals. Dotted lines are obtained considering an initially unchirped (transform-limited) Gaussian pulse with a pulses duration of 140 fs and 200 fs. After propagating through dispersive materials, pulses are chirped giving a broadenig of the spectral bandwidth. Continuous lines are obtained considering the Ti:Sa and OPO cross correlation reported in S3 Fig. at the input of the microscope (i.e. 253 fs), thus a higher spectral bandwidth can be achieved with chirped pulses [ 34]. Orange area highlight the overlap between two excited bandwidths; however in this region the intensities are well below the FWHM values, thus under threshold, so they do not contribute to the Raman signal.
